quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Modulus [/h1]

The [b]modulus [/b]operator, represented by the [b]%[/b] sign, returns the remainder of the division of the first operand by the second operand: [code format="php" codeId="470"]<?php
  $x = 14;
  $y = 3;
  echo [b]$x % $y[/b]; // 2
?>[/code]
[note]If you use floating point numbers with the modulus operator, they will be converted to [b]integers [/b]before the operation.[/note]

[h1]Increment & Decrement [/h1]

The [b]increment [/b]operators are used to increment a variable's value.
The [b]decrement [/b]operators are used to decrement a variable's value. [code format="php"]$x++; // equivalent to $x = $x+1;
$x--; // equivalent to $x = $x-1; [/code]
Increment and decrement operators either precede or follow a variable.[code format="php"]$x++; // post-increment 
$x--; // post-decrement 
++$x; // pre-increment 
--$x; // pre-decrement[/code]
The difference is that the post-increment returns the original value [b]before [/b]it changes the variable, while the pre-increment changes the variable first and then returns the value.
[b]Example:[/b] [code format="php"]$a  = 2; $b = $a++; // $a=3,  $b=2
$a  = 2; $b = ++$a; // $a=3,  $b=3[/code]
